fields.customfield_17579:
‚ÄúPlease fill in the Acceptance crtiteria required:

Customer: 

Name of the impacted customer.
Version:

All versions where behavior has been observed.
User(s) / Role(s) / Group(s) Impacted:

Identification of scope of impact.
Date/Time/timezone issue first observed:

Earliest KNOWN occurrence.
Date/Time/Timezone issue last time worked as expected:

Latest KNOWN proper function.
Recent changes to the platform/implementation/configuration: 

Changes that occurred between earliest known occurrence and last proper function. Includes changes to the core platform, changes to customs, changes to the PIE rules. Any changes that we are aware of that happened during the window between last correct and current behavior.
Who reproduced the behavior (Customer/Reporter)?

Strong preference for REPORTER, but we don‚Äôt want to make this a full blocker to deepening an investigation.
Reproduction Intermittent (Yes/No)?

Strong preference for NO, but there are circumstances where reliable reproduction is challenging and we don‚Äôt want that to block a deeper investigation.
Where was it reproduced?

Include all locations where the reported behavior has been observed alongside locations where we were unable to reproduce. This matrix of reproducibility should provide support for the position that the behavior is due to local customization/configuration. In Service Cloud, this is primarily a distinction between production and training. In non-SC situations, the answer may simply be ‚ÄúN/A‚Äù.
Steps to reproduce the issue (including any preliminary settings/configurations/data necessary to replicate):

When REPORTER REPRODUCED, these should be the steps the reporter used and validated to achieve that reproduction.
Expected Outcome:

Expected outcome should be detailed enough to validate the expectation.
Actual Outcome:

Actual outcome should be detailed enough to validate that this behavior is outside of the expected design.
Additional Information:

Include screenshots, videos, logs and anything else that was discovered/ruled-out during the investigation leading up to the filing of the PSREQ.

projectCategory.description: Projects from SMC a CC following same JIRA flow
projectCategory.name: Social and Commerce Engineering

fields.description:
h3. What?

Show modal with the list of public connected profiles and user select/confirm which of them are competitors.

h3. 
Why?

# Improve knowledge about our customers and their relationship to connected profiles.
# Foundation for competitor listing query


h2. *There are two approaches:*

A. AI pre-selected competitors in a modal (preferred way)

B. Manual ‚Äî no profile preselected

h2. 
*Ideal flow A:*

# Who should see the modal? - Idea:
## Display the modal automatically in the product.
### Show this modal to account or team admins.
### If any admin confirms (selects) competitor profiles, do not show the modal again to anyone else
### Show it to only one person from the account or team at a time; if they skip it, show it to another admin.
### Who to show it to? If we have data on admin activity, show it to the most active admin first, or to the one who connected profiles.
## Show it only when needed‚Äîfor example, when we have the competitor listening widget. The first user sees an empty widget with a button to select competitors, then the modal is shown.
# AI detects competitors (addressed in a separate Jira ticket) ‚Äî identifies account or company names and exports a list of connected public profiles. And get a list of competitors.
# Show modal
## list of all connected public profiles
## competitors are pre-selected
# User changes on confirm competitors
# Competitor profiles are labeled with fuel profile label: [Fuel] - competitor
# Show confirmation snackbars
## can some error happen? Is try again solution?

h3. üõ†Ô∏è How

TBD in [https://emplifi.atlassian.net/browse/FUEL-277|https://emplifi.atlassian.net/browse/FUEL-277|smart-link] 

*Figma here:* [https://www.figma.com/design/9uSZLmMJtaKmiUvozhSPPu/%F0%9F%9A%A7-Fuel-specifications-%E2%80%94-in-progress?node-id=18099-156530&t=RZTBFXafHIAjfB1f-1|https://www.figma.com/design/9uSZLmMJtaKmiUvozhSPPu/%F0%9F%9A%A7-Fuel-specifications-%E2%80%94-in-progress?node-id=18099-156530&t=RZTBFXafHIAjfB1f-1|smart-link] 



!image-20251203-172004.png|width=928,alt="image-20251203-172004.png"!
fields.summary: [Platform] ‚Äî Add competitor label to already connected public profiles

comments.body: I add confirmation snack bars. Not sure if an error can happen and if ‚Äútry again‚Äú is a solution
Adding [~accountid:712020:1e170ed0-893d-47a6-b8b1-6fe78742c5c9]  for copycheck in Figma. Thank you

Hi [~accountid:60ec40b1f664300069ba5291],

I think the headings are good and don‚Äôt need to be changed.

For the text under *Confirm your competitors*:
I would change:
‚Äù_We've pre-selected profiles that we consider your competitors. Confirm or adjust the selection of profiles. You can update or change your decision anytime in Settings/Channels._‚Äù
to
‚Äù_Confirm or adjust the selection of profiles. You can update your selection in Settings ‚Üí Channels._‚Äù I think it‚Äôs obvious enough by the heading that these are the competitor profiles that we have identified, and thus, I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs necessary to call that out.

For the text under *Select your competitors*:
I would change:
‚Äù_Select which of these public profiles belong to your competitors. This will help us provide you with more relevant recommendations.You can update or change your decision anytime in Settings/Channels._‚Äù
to
‚Äù_Select your competitors' profiles. You can update your selection in Settings ‚Üí Channels._‚Äù I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs necessary to call out that this selection will enable us to make better recommendations in this guidance text.

For the snackbars, I would change the successful one to:
_Public profiles successfully labeled_

*Note: In our UX writing training, Salwa mentioned that periods shouldn't be used at the end of single-sentence text when it comes to snackbars, but that they should be used for confirmation modals. I'm not sure which case this is since it's a confirmation in a snackbar, so I leave that up to you.

Hope this helps!

h3. ‚ÅâÔ∏è Grooming questions:

* Q: Will this modal be visible through the whole Suite?
** A: The modal will be visibile only from Command Center.
* Q: When should we show the modal?
** A: Let‚Äôs create some dummy button behind FT just to show the modal. In the future it will be triggered from some Listening widget which we don‚Äôt have today.

[Anshuman Singh|https://gitlab.com/anshuman.singh.ext] mentioned this issue in [a merge request|https://gitlab.com/emplifi/eng/smc/suite/analytics-unified/-/merge_requests/2269] of [Emplifi / eng / smc / suite / analytics-unified|https://gitlab.com/emplifi/eng/smc/suite/analytics-unified] on branch [as/fuel278|https://gitlab.com/emplifi/eng/smc/suite/analytics-unified/-/tree/as/fuel278]:{quote}Draft: [FUEL-278] Add competitor label to already connected public profiles{quote}
